title: Sports Line-Up: What Sri Lankans Can Watch This Weekend
byline: Sri Lankan sports fans have a busy few days ahead with Premier League football, international cricket, and the Las Vegas Grand Prix all lined up.

title: Opposition calls for Select Committee to probe Judicial Service Commission
byline: Opposition MPs representing the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), New Democratic Front (NDF), and Sarvajana Balaya have called for the appointment of a Select Committee to investigate what they describe as questionable conduct by the Judicial Service Commission (JSC).

title: Premier League clubs overhaul financial rules
byline: Premier League clubs voted Friday to overhaul the competition’s financial rules, bringing in a new system that focuses solely on spending that directly affects what happens on the pitch.

title: Shaheens edge Sri Lanka A in last-ball thriller to reach Rising Stars Final
byline: Pakistan Shaheens stormed into the Asia Cup Rising Stars 2025 final after clinching a nail-biting last-ball victory over Sri Lanka A in Doha on Friday night. Defending 153, the Shaheens held their nerve in a gripping semi-final to seal a five-run win and book a title clash with Bangladesh A

title: Met Dept. issues advisory for severe lightning
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an Amber advisory warning of severe lightning in several provinces and districts, effective from 12.00 noon today (22) until 11.30 p.m.

title: Lalith Shiran Gooneratne appointed as acting Chief Justice
byline: Justice of the Supreme Court Anthony Lalith Shiran Gooneratne was sworn in as the Acting Chief Justice before President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (22) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Warrant issued against team manager in LPL match-fixing investigation
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama yesterday ordered the issuance of a warrant against a Pakistani national who served as the manager of the Dambulla Thunders cricket team, over allegations that he aided and abetted attempts to influence players to fix matches during the LPL 2024 tournament.

title: Compensation raised to Rs.10,000 for coconut trees cut down in Matara
byline: The Coconut Cultivation Board (CCB) has announced an increase in the compensation paid for coconut trees cut down in the Matara District due to the rapid spread of the coconut root wilt disease, commonly known as Weligama Wilt.

title: UPDTAE: Rockfall closes Colombo–Kandy road, trapping several in Ganethenna
byline: A section of the Colombo–Kandy main road has been temporarily closed after a rockfall and earth movement struck a shop and a house in the Ganethenna area of Pahala Kadugannawa, leaving 10 people trapped inside.

title: Govt. at snail’s pace in project implementation
byline: Only five out of 79 government construction projects, earmarked to be completed in 2025, have been completed and handed over, Sri Lanka Builders’ Association Chairman Susantha Liyanarachchi said.

title: Man found dead with injuries in three-wheeler in Maharagama
byline: The body of a 57-year-old man was discovered last night (21) in a three-wheeler near the 4th lane of Gammana Road in the Maharagama Police Division.

title: Minor flood alert issued for Nilwala River and Gin Ganga lowlands
byline: The Irrigation Department has warned of a possible minor flood situation in low-lying areas of the Nilwala River and Gin Ganga valleys following heavy rainfall in the upstream and middle-reach catchment areas today.

title: Boats deployed to assist A/L students in flood-affected Galle and Matara
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) has deployed several boats to assist schoolchildren sitting for this year’s G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination in reaching their examination centers in the flood-affected Galle and Matara districts.

title: New pension scheme for fisheries community launches today
byline: The new pension scheme introduced under the 2026 Budget for the fisheries community officially comes into effect today.

title: Cost of living crunch to keep inflation below 3% next year
byline: A crushing cost of living is expected to stifle consumer demand in 2026, keeping inflation well below the Central Bank’s target range and creating a complex environment for interest rates, according to a new analysis by First Capital Research (FCR).

title: National Geographic Traveller Hotel Awards 2025 Uga Halloowella among world’s best
byline: Uga Halloowella, the iconic boutique hotel by Uga Resorts, has been honoured as Runner-Up in the Food Hero Category, at the prestigious National Geographic Traveller Hotel Awards 2025, placed among the 30 best hotels in the world.

title: China unveils new development blueprint, pledges deeper cooperation with Sri Lanka
byline: China’s Fourth Plenary Session of the 20th Central Committee of the Communist Party has introduced a new development blueprint that will open fresh avenues for global partnership—including stronger cooperation with Sri Lanka—the Chinese Ambassador to Colombo said yesterday (21).

title: Coastal line services limited to Weligama after train derails
byline: Train services on the coastal railway line have been limited to Weligama after a slow train travelling from Matara to Colombo Maradana derailed yesterday at around 2.05 p.m. between the Kamburugamuwa and Weligama stations.

title: All divisional secretaries summoned to Colombo for high-level meeting
byline: All Divisional Secretaries islandwide have been summoned to Colombo today (22) for a special high-level discussion, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Leading Indian businessman chooses Sri Lanka for son’s grand wedding
byline: A prominent Indian businessman, Mohan Suresh, has selected Sri Lanka as the destination for the wedding of his son, Jahraan Suresh, marking a significant boost to the country’s tourism and hospitality sectors.

title: Tourism bureau acts against social media posts damaging Sri Lanka’s image
byline: The Tourism Promotion Bureau has confirmed that it is monitoring social media posts by foreign tourists that could negatively affect Sri Lanka’s reputation.
